name: Fish Chowder
author: AMYTHE
summary: The fishermen of Bodega Bay, California shared this favorite, quick and easy recipe with my sister during a Fish Festival. It is one of the best chowders I've had, and my kids love it too! We top with bacon bits and a few shakes of hot sauce for a little spice. Enjoy!
ingredients: 2 pounds cod, diced into 1/2 inch cubes
⅛ teaspoon Old Bay Seasoning TM, or to taste
directions: In a large stockpot, melt 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat
Saute onions, mushrooms and celery in butter until tender
Add chicken stock and potatoes; simmer for 10 minutes
Add fish, and simmer another 10 minutes
Mix together clam juice and flour until smooth; stir into soup and simmer for 1 minute more
Season to taste with   seasoning, salt, and pepper
Remove from heat, and stir in evaporated milk
Top each bowl with crumbled bacon, if desired
